thread.title: Fort Stewart welcomes troops home
thread.title_full: Fort Stewart welcomes troops home | savannahnow.com

author: DispatchDaemon
title: Fort Stewart welcomes troops home
text:
Photos Back | Next U.S. Army photos by Kevin Larson
A redeployment ceremony was held Thursday morning at Fort Stewart for 3rd Infantry Division elements that had been deployed in support of Train, Advise, Assist Command-East, Afghanistan. They were welcomed back to their home installation by family members and friends.
Back | Next A redeployment ceremony was held Thursday morning at Fort Stewart for 3rd Infantry Division elements that had been deployed in support of Train, Advise, Assist Command-East, Afghanistan. They were welcomed back to their home installation by family members and friends.
Back | Next A redeployment ceremony was held Thursday morning at Fort Stewart for 3rd Infantry Division elements that had been deployed in support of Train, Advise, Assist Command-East, Afghanistan. They were welcomed back to their home installation by family members and friends. (U.S. Army photo by Kevin Larson) SPECIAL OFFER FOR NEW READERS 99 cent digital subscription to savannahnow.com

Family members and friends welcomed a few dozen 3rd Infantry Division soldiers as they returned home Thursday morning at Fort Stewart. Soldiers with the 3rd ID had been deployed in support of Train, Advise, Assist Command-East in Afghanistan.
Now they’ve been deployed to Fort Stewart.
TAAC-East’s mission — in partnership with the Afghan government and joint, interagency, intergovernmental and multinational organizations — is to conduct security assistance through Train-Advise-Assist to enable Afghan National Security Forces to help prevent terrorist safe havens in eastern Afghanistan.
TAAC-East synchronizes and coordinates advising and security efforts for U.S. coalition forces in eastern Afghanistan.
Savannah
Morning News
